workflow.name: Optimize SEO meta tags in Google Sheets with Google Gemini
workflow.description:
üîÅ **Loop & Optimize Meta Tags with Google Gemini**

This workflow automates the shortening of meta titles and descriptions for SEO‚Äîdirectly from your Google Sheet, row by row, using Google Gemini.

‚úÖ What it does
- Reads rows from a Google Sheet (meta_title, meta_description, row_index)
- Loops through each row and checks if content exists
- Sends the data to Google Gemini for length-optimized output
- Cleans and parses the response
- Updates the original sheet with the shortened results

üõ†Ô∏è Setup Requirements
- Google Sheets (OAuth2 credentials connected in n8n)
- Google Gemini API key (configured in n8n credentials)

Sheet must contain:
- row_index
- meta_title
- meta_description

Output will be written into:
- meta_titleFixed
- meta_descriptionFixed

parameters.text:
=## INPUT ##

Meta Title: "{{ $json.meta_title }}"
Meta Description: "{{ $json.meta_description }}"

## TASK ##

You are an SEO assistant. Your task is to shorten the following:

Meta Title: Limit to max 60 characters

Meta Description: Limit to max 160 characters

Only shorten if necessary. When shortening:

Keep all core keywords intact.

Do not rewrite unless needed for shortening.

Maintain the original meaning as closely as possible.

Be concise and avoid filler words.

JSON hierarchy MUST be flat and follow this exact format:  
{
  "Index": "{{ $json.row_index }}",  
  "meta_titleFixed": "Meta Title with <60 chars",  
  "meta_descriptionFixed": "Meta Description with <160 chars"
}

parameters.content:
## How it works
- Reads rows from a connected Google Sheet
- Processes each row using Google Gemini to shorten meta titles and descriptions
- Ensures SEO constraints (‚â§¬†60¬†chars for titles, ‚â§¬†160¬†chars for descriptions)
- Preserves core keywords and original meaning
- Cleans and flattens Gemini output
- Writes results back to the sheet

## Setup steps
- Estimated setup time: 10‚Äì15¬†min
- Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials
- Google Gemini API key
- Sheet columns: `row_index`, `meta_title`, `meta_description`
- Output columns `meta_titleFixed` & `meta_descriptionFixed`
- Error handling & formatting built‚Äëin
- Prompt editable in ‚Äúupdate-tags‚Äù node

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
